isis.stitle: TSI 93-16-02 - Process To Remove Tiny Rust Spots From Painted Surfaces

subjectgroup.subject: Process To Remove Tiny Rust Spots From Painted Surfaces

geninfo.para: In today's environment, it's not unusual for vehicles to develop tiny rust spots (see Figure 1)on the horizontal surfaces. These usually come from microscopic metallic particles that can come from numerous sources of industrial fallout. Typically this is surface rust and has come from particles lying on the painted surface and may appear on either the cab or the fiberglass hood. This results in oxidation which can stain the surface of the clearcoat. Upon close examination, a small black dot often appears in the center of the spot. This is the offending material that is causing the oxidation.
Navistar has tested and approved the following procedure that can effectively remove this unsightly spotting.

svcproc.title: PROCESS

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, wear eye protection, rubber gloves and protective clothing. Follow manufacturer's recommended application.

step1.para: Rinse the vehicle to remove unwanted dirt and dust, then proceed as follows:

step2.para: Mix Finish Kare #1119 Soil and Coating Remover, 1 part #1119 to 4 parts of COLDwater.
Use a clean wash mitt and apply the mixture to areas where rust spots have occurred. Keep the surface wet for 5 to 10 minutes.

caution.para: DO NOT allow the mixture to dry or streak down the side of the vehicle.

step2.para: Make sure the vehicle is clean and dry.
Using a dry wash mitt or sponge, apply Finish Kare #833 Rust Remover directly to the surface, one panel at a time.
Keep the area wet for up to 5 minutes.

step1.para: Rinse the surface with a strong jet of water to completely remove the particles.
If the particles are not completely removed, repeat steps 1 and 2.
After the iron particles are removed, apply Finish Kare #118SC Liquid Neutralizer Concentrate Shampoo or equivalent. This is required to neutralize the removal action.

step2.para: Mix the concentrate as 1 part concentrate to 100 parts water.
Apply the neutralizer shampoo with a mitt or sponge.

note.para: The neutralizer concentrate is a heavy duty shampoo.

step1.para: If fine scratches appear on the surface, use an available aftermarket light "finishing" compound with a foam pad to remove scratches.
